## Description {#details}

This file provides a collection of function (or more generally, callable) type erasure utilities supplementing those provided by the standard library in <code>&lt;function&gt;</code>.

It provides <code>unique&#95;function</code>, which works like <code>std::function</code> but supports move-only callable objects and const-qualification.

Future plans:
<ul>
<li>Add a <code>function</code> that provides ref-qualified support, which doesn&#39;t work with <code>std::function</code>.</li>
<li>Provide support for specifying multiple signatures to type erase callable objects with an overload set, such as those produced by generic lambdas.</li>
<li>Expand to include a copyable utility that directly replaces std::function but brings the above improvements.</li>
</ul>


Note that LLVM&#39;s utilities are greatly simplified by not supporting allocators.

If the standard library ever begins to provide comparable facilities we can consider switching to those.

<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/issizelessthanthresholdt-b4cf57b39deb8f9810dc4d1f30f34842"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/issizelessthanthresholdt">IsSizeLessThanThresholdT</a>&lt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/mips/mips16isellowering-cpp/#a0acb682b8260ab1c60b918599864e2e5">T</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/std">std</a>::enable&#95;if&#95;t&lt;sizeof(T) &lt;= 2 &#42; sizeof(void &#42;)&gt;&gt; : std::true&#95;type &#123;&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Provide a type function to map parameters that won&#39;t observe extra copies</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// or moves and which are small enough to likely pass in register to values</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and all other types to l-value reference types. We use this to compute the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// types used in our erased call utility to minimize copies and moves unless</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// doing so would force things unnecessarily into memory.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The heuristic used is related to common ABI register passing conventions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It doesn&#39;t have to be exact though, and in one way it is more strict</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// because we want to still be able to observe either moves &#42;or&#42; copies.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/adjustedparamtbase"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> T&gt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/adjustedparamtbase">AdjustedParamTBase</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;assert</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(!std::is&#95;reference&lt;T&gt;::value,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="normal">                  </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;references should be handled by template specialization&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The pointers to call/move/destroy functions are determined for each</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// callable type (and called-as type, which determines the overload chosen).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (definitions are out-of-line).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// By default, we need an object that contains all the different</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// type erased behaviors needed. Create a static instance of the struct type</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// here and each instance will contain a pointer to it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Wrap in a struct to avoid https://gcc.gnu.org/PR71954</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CallableT, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CalledAs, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Enable = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/callbacksholder"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/callbacksholder">CallbacksHolder</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/callbacksholder/#a95d7bf5688e33a0dd6f133813c5f1abd"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/nontrivialcallbacks">NonTrivialCallbacks</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/callbacksholder/#a95d7bf5688e33a0dd6f133813c5f1abd">Callbacks</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// See if we can create a trivial callback. We need the callable to be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// trivially moved and trivially destroyed so that we don&#39;t have to store</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// type erased callbacks for those operations.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CallableT, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CalledAs&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/callbacksholder-e26dea071331e48430050ba2054ecedc"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/callbacksholder">CallbacksHolder</a>&lt;CallableT, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/calledas">CalledAs</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/detail/#ad8dc8ad9a214d72252a6b01d1d2e6831">EnableIfTrivial</a>&lt;CallableT&gt;&gt; &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/callbacksholder-e26dea071331e48430050ba2054ecedc/#a9fb32c2b52e0428024234887e9e9467a"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/trivialcallback">TrivialCallback</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/callbacksholder-e26dea071331e48430050ba2054ecedc/#a9fb32c2b52e0428024234887e9e9467a">Callbacks</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A simple tag type so the call-as type to be passed to the constructor.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/calledas"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> T&gt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/uniquefunctionbase/calledas">CalledAs</a> &#123;&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Essentially the &quot;main&quot; unique&#95;function constructor, but subclasses</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// provide the qualified type to be used for the call.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (We always store a T, even if the call will use a pointer to const T).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CallableT, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CalledAsT&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
